body: Louisiana Gov. Bobby Jindal (R), who is expected to announce his candidacy for president Wednesday, has always been a man in a hurry. He led the state health department in his mid-20s, first ran for governor in his early 30s and is one of the youngest 2016 candidates, at 44. But perhaps his first political ad ran before all that, when he pitched the Baton Rouge Junior Chamber of Commerce -- a.k.a. the Jaycees -- in this 30-second spot from 1994. That same year, Jindal was given the Jaycees' Outstanding Young Man award. So when Jindal takes to the stage tonight, just remember that, while he's young, he's been building toward this for a very long time.

title: The Fix: Here’s a young Bobby Jindal in perhaps his first campaign ad
